SEARCH
Package org.rcmd.jneuroformats

Class FsColortable

java.lang.Object
org.rcmd.jneuroformats.FsColortable
public class FsColortable extends Object
A FreeSurfer colortable, as used in the annotation files. The colortable maps region codes (labels) to region names and colors. See also the FsAnnot class, which contains an FsColortable object.

  • Field Details

    • structureId

      public List<Integer> structureId
      The structure ID, for internal use only. This is NOT the region code from the annotation file. See the label field for that.

    • red

      public List<Integer> red
      The red value of the RGB color used to visualize the region.

    • green

      public List<Integer> green
      The green value of the RGB color used to visualize the region.

    • blue

      public List<Integer> blue
      The blue value of the RGB color used to visualize the region.

    • transparency

      public List<Integer> transparency
      The transparency value of the RGBA color used to visualize the region. Transparency is 0 - 255, 255 is fully transparent, 0 is fully opaque.

    • structureName

      public List<String> structureName
      The name of the region, e.g. "bankssts".

    • label

      public List<Integer> label
      The region code, as used in the annotation file. This is NOT the structure ID.

  • Constructor Details

    • FsColortable

      public FsColortable()
      Default constructor for FsColortable. Initializes empty lists for all fields.

    • FsColortable

      public FsColortable(List<Integer> structureId, List<Integer> red, List<Integer> green, List<Integer> blue, List<Integer> transparency, List<String> structureName, List<Integer> label)
      Constructor for FsColortable.
      Parameters:
      structureId - the structure IDs, for internal use only. This is NOT the region code from the annotation file. See the label field for that.
      red - the red values of the RGB colors used to visualize the regions.
      green - the green values of the RGB colors used to visualize the regions.
      blue - the blue values of the RGB colors used to visualize the regions.
      transparency - the transparency values of the RGBA colors used to visualize the regions. Transparency is 0 - 255, 255 is fully transparent, 0 is fully opaque.
      structureName - the names of the regions, e.g. "bankssts".
      label - the region codes, as used in the annotation file.

  • Method Details

    • numRegions

      public int numRegions()
      Get the number of regions in this colortable.
      Returns:
      integer, the number of regions.

    • validate

      public void validate() throws IOException
      Validate this FsColortable object. Checks that all lists have the same length.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the lists do not have the same length.

    • getColorsRgb

      public List<Integer> getColorsRgb()
      Get the RGB colors for all regions, as a list of integers. The list contains the red, green, and blue channel values for each vertex, in that order (v0r, v0g, v0b, v1r, v1g, v1b, ...). Color values are in range 0 - 255.
      Returns:
      a list of integers, representing RBG vertex colors.

    • getColorsRgba

      public List<Integer> getColorsRgba(Boolean as_transparency)
      Get the RGBA colors for all regions, as a list of integers. The list contains the red, green, blue and transparency channel values for each vertex, in that order (v0r, v0g, v0b, v0t, v1r, v1g, v1b, v1t, ...). Color values are in range 0 - 255. See function `FsAnnot.getVertexColorsRgb()` if you need to get the colors for a specific vertex or all vertices.
      Parameters:
      as_transparency - whether to use transparency or alpha as the last channel. Transparency is 0 - 255, 255 is fully transparent, 0 is fully opaque. Alpha is 0 - 255, 255 is fully opaque, 0 is fully transparent. Note that the FreeSurfer files store transparency, but most graphics libraries use alpha, so set this to `Boolean.FALSE` if in doubt.
      Returns:
      a list of integers, representing RBGA (or RGBT, depending on the setting of the `as_transparency` parameter) vertex colors.

    • fromFsAnnotFile

      public static FsColortable fromFsAnnotFile(Path filePath) throws IOException
      Read the colortable part of an annot file into an FsColortable object.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the annot file.
      Returns:
      an FsColortable object.
      Throws:
      IOException - if IO error occurs.

    • fromByteBuffer

      protected static FsColortable fromByteBuffer(ByteBuffer buf, int colortableNumEntries) throws IOException
      Read the colortable part of an annot file into an FsColortable object. The colortable is read from the ByteBuffer, starting at the current position in the buffer.
      Parameters:
      buf - the ByteBuffer to read from.
      colortableNumEntries - the number of entries in the colortable. This is the number of entries in the colortable, as specified in the colortable header. Set to -1 if you do not know the number of entries.
      Returns:
      an FsColortable object.
      Throws:
      IOException - if IO error occurs.

    • computeLabelFromRgb

      public static int computeLabelFromRgb(int red, int green, int blue, int alpha)
      Compute the label value from the RGBA color values.
      Parameters:
      red - the red channel value, 0 - 255.
      green - the green channel value, 0 - 255.
      blue - the blue channel value, 0 - 255.
      alpha - the alpha channel value, 0 - 255.
      Returns:
      the label value, as used in the annotation file.

    • computeRgbFromLabel

      public static int[] computeRgbFromLabel(int label)
      Compute the RGBA color values from the label value.
      Parameters:
      label - the label value, as used in the annotation file.
      Returns:
      an array of four integers, representing the red, green, blue, and alpha channel values, in that order. Values are in range 0 - 255.

    • getRgbForLabel

      public Color getRgbForLabel(Integer label)
      Get the RGB color for a given label. Returns null if the label is not found.
      Parameters:
      label - the label to get the color for. Typically the vertex label stored in the annotation file.
      Returns:
      an array of three integers, representing the red, green, and blue channel values, in that order. Values are in range 0 - 255.

      Get a string representation of this FsColortable object.

      a string representation of this FsColortable object.

    • writeFsColortableToByteBuffer

      protected ByteBuffer writeFsColortableToByteBuffer(ByteBuffer buf) throws IOException
      Write the colortable to a ByteBuffer.
      Parameters:
      buf - an existing ByteBuffer to write to. If null, a new ByteBuffer will be created.
      Returns:
      the ByteBuffer, with the colortable written to it.
      Throws:
      IOException - if IO error occurs.
